cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos REGULARES s√£o aqueles que seguem um padr√£o fixo de conjuga√ß√£o. No passado, adicionamos -ED. DICA: Se termina em -ED no passado, √© REGULAR!
cards.englishPhrase: REGULAR verbs follow a fixed conjugation pattern. In past tense, we add -ED. Ex: work‚Üíworked, play‚Üíplayed, study‚Üístudied

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos IRREGULARES n√£o seguem padr√£o no passado - cada um tem sua forma pr√≥pria. DICA: Memorize os mais comuns! Go‚Üíwent, eat‚Üíate, see‚Üísaw
cards.englishPhrase: IRREGULAR verbs don't follow patterns in past tense - each has its own form. Ex: go‚Üíwent, eat‚Üíate, see‚Üísaw, buy‚Üíbought

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos AUXILIARES ajudam outros verbos. BE, DO, HAVE s√£o os principais. DICA: Eles 'auxiliam' a formar tempos verbais e perguntas!
cards.englishPhrase: AUXILIARY verbs help other verbs. BE, DO, HAVE are the main ones. They help form tenses and questions. Ex: Do you work? I have eaten.

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos MODAIS expressam possibilidade, permiss√£o, obriga√ß√£o. Can, could, may, might, must, shall, should, will, would. DICA: Nunca usam TO depois!
cards.englishPhrase: MODAL verbs express possibility, permission, obligation. Can, could, may, might, must, shall, should, will, would. They never use TO after!

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos TRANSITIVOS precisam de objeto direto para completar o sentido. DICA: Pergunte 'O qu√™?' ap√≥s o verbo. Ex: I eat WHAT? ‚Üí an apple
cards.englishPhrase: TRANSITIVE verbs need a direct object to complete meaning. Ask 'What?' after the verb. Ex: I eat an apple. She reads books.

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos INTRANSITIVOS n√£o precisam de objeto - o sentido √© completo. DICA: A a√ß√£o n√£o 'passa' para nada. Ex: She sleeps. The baby cries.
cards.englishPhrase: INTRANSITIVE verbs don't need an object - meaning is complete. Ex: She sleeps. The baby cries. He arrived. They laughed.

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos de LIGA√á√ÉO conectam sujeito a caracter√≠stica/estado. BE √© o principal. DICA: Ligam sujeito a adjetivo! Ex: She IS happy. He SEEMS tired.
cards.englishPhrase: LINKING verbs connect subject to characteristic/state. BE is the main one. Ex: She is happy. He seems tired. It looks beautiful.

cards.portuguesePhrase: PHRASAL VERBS s√£o verbo + part√≠cula com novo significado. DICA: Look up (procurar), give up (desistir), turn on (ligar) - memorize como express√µes!
cards.englishPhrase: PHRASAL VERBS are verb + particle with new meaning. Ex: look up (search), give up (quit), turn on (activate), break down (stop working)

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos REFLEXIVOS mostram que sujeito faz a√ß√£o em si mesmo. DICA: Usam myself, yourself, etc. Ex: I hurt MYSELF. She taught HERSELF.
cards.englishPhrase: REFLEXIVE verbs show subject does action to itself. Use myself, yourself, himself, herself. Ex: I hurt myself. She taught herself.

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos CAUSATIVOS mostram que algu√©m faz outra pessoa fazer algo. DICA: MAKE, LET, HAVE, GET s√£o os principais. Ex: I MADE him study.
cards.englishPhrase: CAUSATIVE verbs show someone causes another to do something. MAKE, LET, HAVE, GET. Ex: I made him study. She had her car fixed.

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos de PERCEP√á√ÉO descrevem sentidos. DICA: See, hear, feel, smell, taste, watch, notice. Podem usar infinitivo sem TO ou -ING!
cards.englishPhrase: PERCEPTION verbs describe senses. See, hear, feel, smell, taste, watch, notice. Ex: I saw him leave / leaving. She heard them sing / singing.

cards.portuguesePhrase: STATIVE verbs descrevem estados, n√£o a√ß√µes. DICA: N√£o usam -ING normalmente! Know, believe, want, need, like, love, hate, prefer.
cards.englishPhrase: STATIVE verbs describe states, not actions. They don't usually use -ING! Know, believe, want, need, like, love, hate, prefer, belong.

cards.portuguesePhrase: DYNAMIC/ACTION verbs descrevem a√ß√µes que acontecem. DICA: Podem usar todos os tempos! Run, eat, work, play, write, speak, walk.
cards.englishPhrase: DYNAMIC/ACTION verbs describe actions that happen. They can use all tenses! Run, eat, work, play, write, speak, walk, cook, drive.

cards.portuguesePhrase: Verbos DITRANSITIVOS t√™m objeto direto E indireto. DICA: Responda 'O qu√™?' e 'Para quem?'. Ex: She gave ME (indireto) a BOOK (direto).
cards.englishPhrase: DITRANSITIVE verbs have direct AND indirect object. Ex: She gave me a book. He told them a story. I sent her flowers.
She suggested going to the cinema.

cards.portuguesePhrase: Eu o fiz estudar. (MAKE + infinitivo sem TO)
Ela o deixou ir. (LET + infinitivo sem TO)
Eu o vi sair. (percep√ß√£o + infinitivo sem TO)
Ela o ouviu cantar. (percep√ß√£o + infinitivo sem TO)
Eu parei de fumar. (stop + -ING = parar de)
Eu parei para fumar. (stop + TO = parar para)
Lembro de trancar a porta. (remember + -ING = lembrar do passado)
Lembre de trancar a porta. (remember + TO = lembrar de fazer)
